titleStmt.title: The unhappy favourite, or, The Earl of Essex a tragedy : acted at the Theatre Royal by Their Majesty's servants / written by John Bankes.
titleStmt.author: Banks, John, d. 1706.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A30847 of text R10948 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing B663). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 173 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 43 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The unhappy favourite, or, The Earl of Essex a tragedy : acted at the Theatre Royal by Their Majesty's servants / written by John Bankes.

Dryden, John, 1631-1700.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Bentley and Mary Magnes ...,

notesStmt.note: Prologues by Major Mohun, John Dryden and the author. Epilogue also by Dryden.
Later editions appeared under title: The Earl of Essex, or, The unhappy favourite.
Reproduction of original in British Library.
